model

Class DataAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.DataAccessor

  • public class DataAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
    To maintain low coupling, the controller will access model components through this class. Through this class, fuel, program, user, satisfaction, and vehicle data will be initialized, retrieved and modified, all while preserving encapsulation.
    Author:
    Nolan Slade

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataAccessor()
      Constructor for the data accessor Creates objects which do not require user preferences, including programData, vehicleData and fuelData and initiates their sub routines

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataAccessor

        public DataAccessor()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor for the data accessor Creates objects which do not require user preferences, including programData, vehicleData and fuelData and initiates their sub routines
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs during object creation, likely from file reading

    • Method Detail

      • setToUser

        public void setToUser(java.lang.String[] userPref)
        Will customize the application given the user's preferences Specified format of parameter is form factor, fuel type, driver type, model year, geographic region. The function will then call all necessary procedures on the data to achieve a result for the user.
        Parameters:
        userPref - An array of strings holding user preferences in specified format

      • getVehicleResults

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> getVehicleResults()
        Will return the vehicle results of program execution for display by the view
        Returns:
        An array list of string arrays containing the top 5 vehicle information (make/model/fuel consump/fuel cost/satisfaction)
